comment._content: ...in the days when a game called "Hop Ching" was ok and not deemed racist...

comment.author: 15376845@N00
comment._content: The Hop Ching game was chinese checkers. I had those as a kid...wow!

comment.author: 13643384@N05
comment._content: i wish i lived back in that era....or at least go back in time for a day to experience what it was like.

comment.author: 20352541@N00
comment._content: Doesn't seem right, not to have a Red Ryder Range Model Air Rifle in the window amongst those other toys.  ;-)

comment.author: 21480196@N03
comment._content: What a nice view into the past.

comment.author: 17264356@N00
comment._content: "Chinese checkers" began as an American game played on a 16x16 square checker board. A German variation introduced the six-sided star version, which got renamed upon being brought back the the United States. There is nothing Chinese about the game at all. Wikipedia entry -- Found in a search. (?)

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: Many of the toys are sitting on their pasteboard boxes for display. Those were the days! Now everything's wired inside plastic blister packs and you need a set of tools to get them out.

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Playthings of the Past: Antique Photos of Dolls, Toys, & Games, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Shoot thru Glass: Window Displays, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 48793241@N07
comment._content: I love seeing how the shops displayed things back then...

comment.author: 89935782@N02
comment._content:
"HOP CHING - The Newest Craze For Young And Old". 
Do a Google image search for "Hop Ching" to see the ridiculous racist box art--- a grinning "Chinaman" complete with long pointy fingernails and an opium pipe.

comment.author: 9243200@N04
comment._content: It was 70 years ago....Not like things haven't changed a bit since then.
